Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2016 04:00PM dcjoslin56 wrote: Greetings; Stage 3B in 2008, ILC, lumpectomy, 9/10 lymph nodes removed, 7 chemo treatments, 38 radiation treatments Stage 4 in 2015, ILC, large tumor in left armpit is wrapped around nerves and blood vessels, so surgery impossible, no radiation; am taking Ibrance and Femara for 1 year now. Have had 3 PET scans; first two showed shrinkage of tumor, third one showed a plateau; What does de novo mean? Is anyone else in a similar position as i am? What does your oncologist tell you about length of life? Would love to chat with someone in my position. Thank you, Diane
Posts.Title: How Many Are We? zarovka SimonH

Posts.Content: dcjoslin56 wrote: I've just been told I have Stage 3a or Stage 3b ILC, 9+ lymph nodes and am waiting for results on a bone scan and CT scan to see if there is any spread. Had a lumpectomy on 4/17/08. Stage 3 sounds very scary; what is the prognosis for this stage? Dx 3/13/2008, ILC, 5cm, Stage IIIA, 9/10 nodes, ER+/PR- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Unsubscribe? dcjoslin56 Luckynumber47

Posts.Content: dcjoslin56 wrote: I am a 6-year survivor of Stage III breast cancer.  That's the good part.  Mammograms are horribly painful for me, and I usually end up screeching and crying.  I omit caffeine from my system for a good month beforehand and take Vicodin an hour before.  Nothing works.  I had an area of pain 6 months ago on the opposite side of the cancer and had a biopsy, which showed no cancer.  I am due for a mammogram now and DO NOT WANT TO DO IT!  I know I should, but I just can't face it.  Suggestions?  Help. Dx 3/13/2008, ILC, 5cm, Stage IIIA, 9/10 nodes, ER+/PR- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Horribly painful mammograms! dcjoslin56 angelia50
